abstracts.cdata!:
This resettlement policy framework (RPF)
            provides the guidelines to minimize the negative impacts of
            land acquisition, and involuntary resettlement resulting
            from implementation of the Local Government Support Program
            Project. Resettlement and compensation will be executed as
            sustainable development programs, providing investment
            resources to give displaced persons the opportunity to share
            project benefits. Community compensation will be in-kind
            only, in the form of reconstruction of facilities, such as
            school building (public or religious), public toilets, well
            or pump, market place, road, and/or storage warehouse.
            Compensation for loss of land will be at replacement costs
            for equal productive value, or in cash estimated at market
            values in the local currency adjusted to inflation; however,
            in-kind compensation may also include items such as land,
            houses, building materials, seedlings, agricultural inputs,
            and financial credits for equipment. Crop losses will be
            compensated based on: cash crops, determined at the average
            value over the previous year, corrected for inflation;
            subsistence crops will be determined at the highest value
            over the previous year, corrected for inflation. The value
            of stable crops will be determined at the highest market
            price reached during the year. Given the significance of
            horticultural, floricultural and fruit trees - particularly
            mangoes and coconut - to the local subsistence economy,
            compensation will be on a combined replacement/market value
            form. Other domestic cash crops, and fruit trees, considered
            "wild" trees, will be compensated under the
            umbrella of the village, or community compensation. Examples
            are: avocado, bananas, guava, citrus fruits, papaya,
            tamarind, etc.
